title: Remembrance - best describes a central paradox

content.question: Which of the following best describes a central paradox of the poem?

choices.label: The speaker, attempting to grow closer to a lost love, becomes even more distant from the loved one.
The speaker, in the act of remembering a childhood love, comes to an increasing awareness of mortality.
The speaker, in the act of mourning, is able to experience a newfound joy.
The speaker, worrying over forgetting a deceased lover, reveals the extent of that loved one’s continuing memory.

content.answer: The speaker, worrying over forgetting a deceased lover, reveals the extent of that loved one’s continuing memory.
